Description: Tondo and foot sherd of Attic black-glazed pottery large open vessel; interior black; exterior: stem red; top of foot black, edge and resting surface reserved; inside wall and underside of foot black with reserved band at junction of wall and foot.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
1912.40 written on sherd; ‘P’ added at BM on scan and information sheet to distinguish it from the other 1912.40 sherds.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.2021)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
